intro: Hedyotis srilankensis, commonly known as the Srilankan pennywort, is a small herbaceous plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, white flowers clustered in cymes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in the study of tropical flora.
